intro: Ranunculus pulchellus var. longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with slender, hairy stems that are characteristic of the variety. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its ornamental value and role in supporting local pollinators.
